title: Ticket #5454: HTCondor View: Add a date picker
description: For browsers that don't natively implement input type=date, we should provied a fallback date picker, perhaps jQueryUI's. We'd want to detect if the platform provides a native one, which is likely to be better, especially on mobile platforms. We could use Moderizr to detect the availability.
remarks:
2015-Dec-23 15:46:26 by adesmet:
Took the technique Modernizr uses to set Modernizr.inputtypes.date and reimplemented. This is only a reasonable solution because we want one very small feature. The result is smaller and faster (because even doing a custom Modernizr build, it will test for other input types we don't care about). If we start caring about more options, we should just use Modernizr.

In short: If we can't set the input's type to "date", or it will accept an invalid date, then the platform doesn't support it.

If there is not native date picker, we use jQueryUI's.
